data.enText: when a horse or similar animal gallops , it moves very fast and each stride includes a stage when all four feet are off the ground together
to ride a horse very fast, usually at a gallop

data.chText: 乔骑马穿过田野向他奔去。
data.enText: Jo galloped across the field towards him.
She came galloping down the street.
the fastest speed at which a horse can run, with a stage in which all four feet are off the ground together
He rode off at a gallop .
My horse suddenly broke into a gallop .
a ride on a horse at its fastest speed

simple_means.memory_skill: gal 尖叫 + lop 跑 → 尖叫着跑走 → 疾驰

tr: a fast gait of a horse
a two-beat stride during which all four legs are off the ground simultaneously

example: He was galloping down the road

tr: cause to move at full gallop
example: Did you gallop the horse just now?

value.def: When a horse gallops, it runs very fast so that all four legs are off the ground at the same time. If you gallop a horse, you make it gallop.

example.ex: Staff officers galloped fine horses down the road.
example.tran: 参谋官们骑着骏马一路疾驰而去。

value.def: If you gallop, you ride a horse that is galloping.

example.ex: Major Winston galloped into the distance.
example.tran: 温斯顿少校策马疾驰而去。

value.def: A gallop is a ride on a horse that is galloping.

example.ex: I was forced to attempt a gallop.

value.def: If something such as a process gallops, it develops very quickly and is often difficult to control.

example.ex: In spite of the recession, profits have galloped ahead.
example.tran: 尽管还处于萧条期，利润却迅猛增长。

value.def: If you gallop, you run somewhere very quickly.

example.ex: They are galloping around the garden playing football.
example.tran: 他们在园子里飞跑着踢足球。

value.def: If you do something at a gallop, you do it very quickly.

example.ex: I read the book at a gallop.
example.tran: 我飞快地读完了这本书。

partsOfSpeech.dec: e 出 + lop 跑 + e → 出跑 → 私奔
gal 尖叫 + lop 跑 → 尖叫着跑走 → 疾驰
inter 在…之间 + lop 跑 + er 人 → 跑入二者之间 → 入侵者
